item.title: Senior Hezbollah commander gunned down
item.description: A senior commander of militant Shiite group Hezbollah is shot dead outside his home in Beirut. Israel has denied involvement in the killing.
item.ExtractedText: By Nick Paton Walsh and Marie-Louise Gumuchian, CNN December 4, 2013 -- Updated 1007 GMT (1807 HKT) STORY HIGHLIGHTS Source: The commander was shot four times Hezbollah blamed Israel Israel denied the accusation Beirut, Lebanon (CNN) -- A senior Hezbollah commander was killed outside his home in Beirut early Wednesday, a Lebanese security official told CNN. Hassan Al-Laqees was shot four times, "In the head and in the shoulder," the source said. The source added that a silenced pistol was probably used and there were "maybe" two or three attackers. Hezbollah said Laqees was "assassinated" in the southern district of Hadath as he was returning home from work. The militant Shiite group blamed Israel for the killing -- but Israel denied it. '"This is strictly nothing to do with Israel," Yigal Palmor, spokesman for the Israeli Foreign Ministry said. Hezbollah said Laqees had been a member of the group since its formation. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reported from Beirut, Lebanon; Marie-Louise Gumuchian wrote from London
